pr_title: Optimize ArrayAllocator CPU usage in OptimizedPartitionedOutputOperator

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't this loop release memory of "discarded" arrays? E.g. intArrays[intArraysTop] = null?
timeline.author: mbasmanova

replies.bodyText: @mbasmanova hi Masha, the arrays will be released when the stack grows back, but you're right, we should explicitly release them. I'll make the change in next iteration.
replies.author: yingsu00

timeline.message:
Introduce UncheckedStackArrayAllocator

UncheckedStackArrayAllocator has about 7x performance improvement than
SimpleArrayAllocator:

Benchmark                                              (arrayAllocatorType)  Mode  Cnt     Score     Error  Units
BenchmarkArrayAllocator.borrowAndReturnArrays          SimpleArrayAllocator  avgt   30  2900.559 ± 115.698  ms/op
BenchmarkArrayAllocator.borrowAndReturnArrays  UncheckedStackArrayAllocator  avgt   30   423.383 ±  20.460  ms/op

Revert "Add max buffer count config property for optimized repartitioning"

This reverts commit 726e18ae85e583b8493c39f97761e9f2976e2298.
